channel.title: tools on openQA bites
channel.description: Recent content in tools on openQA bites

item.title: seidl - display current SUSE publiccloud images in your terminal
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: seidl is a small pint query utility designed to easily list the current publiccloud images in the terminal. Pint (Public Cloud Information Tracker) is the SUSE service to provide data about the current state of publiccloud images across all supported public cloud service providers.

item.title: Extract SCHEDULE from an openQA job
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: Then using openqa-clone-job (and derivates) one can use the SCHEDULE variable to clone a test run with a custom set of test modules. This is particular useful, when developing a new test case and you need a verification run with e.

item.title: Clean empty job groups in openQA
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: In this blog post I present you a small script, which can help you to remove empty job groups from your own openQA instance. This is helpful if you have a development instance with a lot of job groups, that you never use.

item.title: pasta - stupid simple pastebin service
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: pasta is a stupid simple pastebin service for self-hosting. I started this project months ago because I was missing an easy, simple and no pain self-hosting solution.

item.title: Active monitoring of openQA jobs
item.author: felix.niederwanger@suse.de (phoenix)
item.description: openqa-mon is a little command-line utility to monitor one or multiple openQA jobs for their status. This tool is useful if you want to live monitor a handful of jobs closely e.
